name: Overview
main:
A high influx of Rohingya refugees into Cox’s Bazar in the southeast of the country has been steadily increasing since late August 2017, with the current number at over 693,000. Needs among Rohingya are high, as they flee a major government crackdown in Rakhine state, Myanmar. Prior to this development, Bangladesh was already hosting almost 213,000 Rohingya refugees. Needs are likely to be exacerbated as the monsoon season approaches.

INFORM measures Bangladesh's risk of humanitarian crisis and disaster to be high, at 5.8/10. Bangladesh’s exposure to hazards is of particular concern, at 7.5/10.?
latest_developments_past:
14/05: 16,000 people have been relocated within camps to mitigate the risk from the monsoon.?

12/05: 120 people were displaced in May due to pre-monsoon rains causing flooding and landslides. Over 7,100 people were affected.?
